glsa.title: tla: Heap-based buffer overflow in included libneon
glsa.synopsis: tla includes a vulnerable version of the neon library.

background.p: GNU Arch (tla) is a revision control system suited for widely distributed development.

description.p: Stefan Esser discovered a vulnerability in the code of the neon library (GLSA 200405-13): if a malicious date string is passed to the ne_rfc1036_parse() function, it can trigger a string overflow into static heap variables. tla includes it's own version of the library.

impact.p: When connected to a malicious WebDAV server, this vulnerability could allow execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running tla.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All users of tla should upgrade to the latest stable version:
